instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Touch Bar
threads.message:
Board was liquid damaged around J5100
Resistors around showing correct values.

Diode on J5100 show same values like another board.
No Touch Bar with brand new part.


<SIGNAL>SPI_DFR_MISO_R</SIGNAL> = 1.68V
<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_INT_L</SIGNAL> = 1.73V
<SIGNAL>DFR_LID_OPEN_L</SIGNAL> = 0.02V
<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 0.058V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2RSW_DFR</SIGNAL> = 1.80V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_DFR_FILT</SIGNAL> = 5.13V

<RESISTOR>R5103</RESISTOR> got correct 4.67k resistance.

SPI in diode mode:
<SIGNAL>SPI_DFR_MISO_R</SIGNAL> = 0.458V
<SIGNAL>SPI_DFR_CLK</SIGNAL> = 0.458V
<SIGNAL>SPI_DFR_CS_L</SIGNAL> = 0.448V
<SIGNAL>SPI_DFR_MOSI</SIGNAL> = 0.459V

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Touch Bar
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL> should be high, I think.
Can you compare with good board?

Check voltage and signals for J5110 too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Touch Bar
threads.message:
Dont have access to working board anymore.

J5110
<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_VSYNC</SIGNAL> = 0.512V
<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_INT</SIGNAL> 0.0V
<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_TE</SIGNAL> 0.0V
<SIGNAL>DFR_DISP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 1.79V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2RSW_DFR</SIGNAL> = 1.80V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3HSW_DFR</SIGNAL> = 3.34V

In Diode mode:
<SIGNAL>MIPI_DFR_CLK_CONN_FILT_P</SIGNAL> = 0.485V
<SIGNAL>MIPI_DFR_CLK_CONN_FILT_N</SIGNAL> = 0.485V
<SIGNAL>MIPI_DFR_DATA_CONN_FILT_P</SIGNAL> = 0.484V
<SIGNAL>MIPI_DFR_DATA_CONN_FILT_N</SIGNAL> = 0.484V
<SIGNAL>I2C_DFR_SCL_R</SIGNAL> = 0.445V 
<SIGNAL>I2C_DFR_SDA_R</SIGNAL> = 0.445V

I compared J5110 in diode mode with another board where SSD failed and got the same readings.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Touch Bar
threads.message: Touchbar reset seems bad; can you compare with another machine (even other model)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Touch Bar
threads.message:
Made a stupid mistake - was checking voltage <SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and flex was not connected.
With flex connected got on <RESISTOR>R5103</RESISTOR>/1 1.78V and on <RESISTOR>R5103</RESISTOR>/2 1.77V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Touch Bar
threads.message:
There must be something else affected by liquid spill.
Possibly bad traces, or even damaged T2 (its touchbar control section).
